description: Post-Alduin Thu'um mechanics available to Nords and select other races through study and training, not Dragonborn-exclusive powers.

removed_mechanics: Automatic soul absorption on dragon death
lore_compliance.new_approach: Thu'um is an ancient Nordic tradition that can be learned through dedication, training, and discovering Word Walls. While rare, skilled Nords (and some Imperials/Bretons) can master the Voice through discipline.

available_races.notes: Nords have natural affinity. Bretons and Imperials can learn but require additional dedication (longer mastery clocks or higher Fate Point costs).

initial_cost.description: Using a Thu'um initially requires spending a Fate Point

mastery_clock.name: Shout Mastery Clock
mastery_clock.description: Each shout has its own mastery clock. As you use and practice a shout, fill segments. Once complete, the shout becomes 'once per scene' without Fate Point cost.
advancement: Fill 1 segment: Use shout successfully in meaningful situation
Fill 2 segments: Use shout in critical/dramatic moment
Fill 1 segment: Receive training from master (Greybeards, Ulfric, etc.)
mastery_clock.completion_benefit: Shout can be used once per scene without Fate Point cost. Still subject to cooldown.

cooldown.description: Prevents overuse of Thu'um in rapid succession
cooldown.standard: Once per scene for mastered shouts
cooldown.unmastered: Once per session without special circumstances (must spend Fate Point each use)
cooldown.reduced_cooldown: With GM permission and appropriate aspect invocation, may use twice per scene

available_shouts.name: Unrelenting Force (Fus Ro Dah)
available_shouts.effect: Knock foes back and potentially off their feet

mechanics.action_type: Overcome vs. Target's Athletics or Physique (defender's choice)
mechanics.one_word: Weapon:1 attack, pushes target to adjacent zone on success
mechanics.two_words: Weapon:2 attack, pushes target two zones away, target takes -1 to actions next exchange
mechanics.three_words: Weapon:3 attack, pushes all targets in zone back, creates 'Knocked Down' situation aspect

available_shouts.mastery_benefits: Mastered version: Targets hit by 3-word shout must overcome Great (+4) difficulty or be stunned (skip next action)
available_shouts.cooldown: Once per scene (mastered) or costs 1 Fate Point (unmastered)

available_shouts.name: Whirlwind Sprint (Wuld Nah Kest)
available_shouts.effect: Move with supernatural speed across distances

mechanics.one_word: Move one additional zone instantly (beyond normal movement)
mechanics.two_words: Move up to three zones instantly, +2 to Athletics to overcome movement obstacles
mechanics.three_words: Move up to five zones instantly, ignore all ground-based obstacles, gain +1 to defend until end of exchange

available_shouts.mastery_benefits: Mastered version: Can use as a reaction to avoid attacks, gaining +2 to defend
available_shouts.cooldown: Once per scene (mastered) or costs 1 Fate Point (unmastered)

available_shouts.name: Elemental Fury (Su Grah Dun)
available_shouts.effect: Enhance attack speed and ferocity temporarily

mechanics.one_word: Create 'Swift Strikes' aspect with one free invoke, +1 to Fight this exchange
mechanics.two_words: Create 'Furious Assault' aspect with two free invokes, +2 to Fight for two exchanges
mechanics.three_words: Create 'Supernatural Speed' aspect with three free invokes, +2 to Fight and +1 to defend for entire scene (max 3 exchanges)

available_shouts.mastery_benefits: Mastered version: Gain an extra attack action during first exchange of effect
available_shouts.cooldown: Once per scene (mastered) or costs 1 Fate Point (unmastered)
available_shouts.notes: Only works with physical weapons, not magic

available_shouts.name: Frost Breath (Fo Krah Diin)
available_shouts.effect: Breathe freezing cold that damages and slows enemies

mechanics.one_word: Weapon:2 attack, create 'Chilled' aspect on target
mechanics.two_words: Weapon:3 attack to all in zone, create 'Frozen Slowed' aspect, targets take -1 to Athletics
mechanics.three_words: Weapon:4 attack to all in zone and adjacent zone, create 'Deep Freeze' aspect, targets must overcome Fair (+2) to take physical actions

available_shouts.mastery_benefits: Mastered version: Frozen targets take additional 1 stress on successful attacks against them
available_shouts.cooldown: Once per scene (mastered) or costs 1 Fate Point (unmastered)

available_shouts.name: Fire Breath (Yol Toor Shul)

mechanics.one_word: Weapon:2 fire attack to single target
mechanics.two_words: Weapon:3 fire attack to all in zone, create 'On Fire' aspect
mechanics.three_words: Weapon:4 fire attack to all in zone, create 'Burning' lasting aspect (1 stress per exchange for 2 exchanges unless extinguished)

available_shouts.mastery_benefits: Mastered version: Burning aspect lasts 3 exchanges and deals 2 stress per exchange
available_shouts.cooldown: Once per scene (mastered) or costs 1 Fate Point (unmastered)

available_shouts.name: Become Ethereal (Feim Zii Gron)
available_shouts.effect: Become incorporeal and immune to harm temporarily

mechanics.one_word: Gain +3 to defend against one attack, take no consequence if you would be taken out
mechanics.two_words: Become incorporeal for one exchange: immune to physical damage, cannot attack, can move through obstacles
mechanics.three_words: Become incorporeal for two exchanges: immune to all damage, cannot attack, can move freely, survive any fall

available_shouts.mastery_benefits: Mastered version: Can attack during final exchange of ethereal state at -2 penalty
available_shouts.cooldown: Twice per scene (mastered) or costs 1 Fate Point (unmastered)
available_shouts.notes: Cannot deal damage while ethereal. Excellent for escapes and environmental hazards.

available_shouts.name: Dragonrend (Joor Zah Frul)
available_shouts.effect: Forces flying creatures to land and makes dragons vulnerable

mechanics.three_words_only: Force target dragon or flying creature to land immediately. Create 'Grounded' aspect with two free invokes. Dragon takes -2 to all actions for one exchange due to existential shock.
mechanics.special: This is the only shout that REQUIRES all three words. Cannot be used incrementally.

available_shouts.mastery_benefits: Mastered version: Grounded duration extends to two exchanges, -3 penalty to dragon actions
available_shouts.cooldown: Once per session (even when mastered), or costs 2 Fate Points (unmastered)
available_shouts.lore_note: Created by ancient mortals specifically to combat dragons. Incredibly powerful but rare. Must be learned from specific quest/story event.
training_locations: Quest reward only - learn from ancient Nord heroes' spirits or special story event

available_shouts.name: Kyne's Peace (Kaan Drem Ov)
available_shouts.effect: Pacify animals and make them non-hostile

mechanics.one_word: Calm one animal, make non-hostile for scene
mechanics.two_words: Calm all animals in zone, make non-hostile for scene
mechanics.three_words: Calm all animals in zone and adjacent zones, make non-hostile for session, can give simple commands

available_shouts.mastery_benefits: Mastered version: Animals become temporarily friendly and may assist party
available_shouts.cooldown: Once per scene (mastered) or costs 1 Fate Point (unmastered)
available_shouts.notes: Only works on natural animals (wolves, bears, etc.), not daedric creatures or undead

available_shouts.name: Aura Whisper (Laas Yah Nir)
available_shouts.effect: Sense living beings through walls and obstacles

mechanics.one_word: Detect all living beings in current zone, create 'Sensed Presence' aspect
mechanics.two_words: Detect all living beings in current and adjacent zones, learn their approximate type (humanoid, creature, etc.)
mechanics.three_words: Detect all living beings within three zones, learn their type and hostile/neutral intent, create 'Perfect Awareness' aspect with two free invokes

available_shouts.mastery_benefits: Mastered version: Also detect undead and magical wards
available_shouts.cooldown: Once per scene (mastered) or costs 1 Fate Point (unmastered)

available_shouts.name: Disarm (Zun Haal Viik)
available_shouts.effect: Force enemies to drop their weapons

mechanics.one_word: Force one target to drop weapon, must use action to retrieve it
mechanics.two_words: Force up to two targets to drop weapons, weapons fly one zone away
mechanics.three_words: All enemies in zone drop weapons and shields, items fly to random adjacent zones, create 'Disarmed' situation aspect

available_shouts.mastery_benefits: Mastered version: Disarmed opponents also take -2 to defend until rearmed
available_shouts.cooldown: Once per scene (mastered) or costs 1 Fate Point (unmastered)

available_shouts.name: Storm Call (Strun Bah Qo)
available_shouts.effect: Summon a devastating lightning storm (outdoor use only)

mechanics.three_words_only: Call down a storm that strikes random targets (friend or foe) with lightning for next 3 exchanges. Each exchange, roll 4dF: on + or ++, lightning strikes (Weapon:4 attack) a random target in area. Create 'Raging Storm' aspect.
mechanics.special: Can only be used outdoors. Affects everyone in encounter, including party members. Lasts 3 exchanges once called.

available_shouts.mastery_benefits: Mastered version: Can direct one lightning strike per exchange to chosen target
available_shouts.cooldown: Once per session (mastered) or costs 2 Fate Points (unmastered)
available_shouts.lore_note: Extremely powerful but dangerous to all. Use with caution.

nord_racial_extra.name: Voice of the Nord
nord_racial_extra.description: As a Nord, you've been taught one word of the Thu'um by elders or discovered it through heritage.
nord_racial_extra.benefit: Choose ONE 3-word shout from: Unrelenting Force, Whirlwind Sprint, or Kyne's Peace. You know ONE word of this shout at character creation. Start with 2 segments filled on its mastery clock.

at_character_creation.other_races: Bretons and Imperials cannot start with Thu'um at creation but can learn through gameplay.

learning_methods.description: Ancient walls inscribed with words of power throughout Skyrim
learning_methods.mechanics: Discovering a Word Wall teaches one word of a specific shout. Must pass Lore check (difficulty varies) to understand and internalize the word. Adds 1 word to known shout or teaches new shout.
learning_methods.locations: Various dungeons, mountaintops, and ancient ruins across Skyrim

learning_methods.description: Join or petition the Greybeards at High Hrothgar
learning_methods.mechanics: Complete pilgrimage to High Hrothgar. Must prove dedication through trials. Greybeards can teach one word per major milestone or significant dedication. Gain +2 segments on mastery clock for any shout they teach.
learning_methods.requirements: Must show respect for the Way of the Voice, pass tests of character

learning_methods.description: Ulfric learned from Greybeards but used Thu'um in war
learning_methods.mechanics: If aligned with Stormcloaks and gain high reputation, Ulfric may teach Unrelenting Force. Teaches practical, combat-focused approach. Gain +1 segment on mastery clock but takes longer to master (9 segments instead of 8) due to aggressive use.
learning_methods.requirements: High loyalty to Stormcloaks, complete significant quests, must specifically request training

learning_methods.description: Dedicated roleplay and practice to unlock latent knowledge
learning_methods.mechanics: Create a 10-segment 'Meditation Clock' for learning a new word. Fill segments through: dedicated RP scenes, spending Fate Points for insight (1 FP = 1 segment), major breakthroughs in story (2 segments), Lore checks during downtime. When filled, learn one word of chosen shout.
learning_methods.requirements: Must already know at least one word of the shout, dedicated in-character effort

learning_methods.description: Rare books or scrolls contain Thu'um knowledge
learning_methods.mechanics: Discovering specific texts (GM-determined rare finds) can teach understanding of shouts. Requires Great (+4) Lore check and one week of study time. Success grants one word of a shout.
learning_methods.examples: College of Winterhold archives, Dragonborn Gallery, ancient Nordic tombs

learning_methods.description: OPTIONAL: If GM allows dragons in post-Alduin campaign
learning_methods.mechanics: When party defeats a dragon, any character with at least one known word of Thu'um may attempt Will check (Superb +5) to absorb a fragment of dragon soul. Success grants instant understanding of one word of any shout. Can only be done once per dragon.
learning_methods.lore_note: This is the Dragonborn method but extremely difficult for non-Dragonborn. Most characters will fail this check. Reserved for epic moments.

nord.base_affinity: Natural connection to Thu'um through heritage
nord.mechanics: Standard mastery clocks (8 segments), can choose one shout at creation, -1 difficulty on Lore checks to learn from Word Walls

breton.base_affinity: Magical aptitude helps understand Thu'um as magic-adjacent
breton.mechanics: Mastery clocks have 10 segments (slower mastery), cannot start with Thu'um, +1 difficulty on learning from Word Walls BUT +2 to learning from texts/study due to scholarly nature

imperial.base_affinity: Disciplined study allows learning but requires dedication
imperial.mechanics: Mastery clocks have 10 segments, cannot start with Thu'um, standard difficulty on learning but excels at Greybeard training due to discipline (+1 segment when training with masters)

integration_with_fate_core.as_stunts: Each known shout can be represented as a stunt in character creation/advancement. Cost: 1 Refresh per shout known (all three words).
integration_with_fate_core.as_extras: Thu'um can be taken as an Extra, granting access to the entire system. Cost: 1 Refresh for the Extra, then individual shouts cost Fate Points or are earned through story.
integration_with_fate_core.recommended_approach: Extra system - take 'Way of the Voice' Extra for 1 Refresh, gain ability to learn and use shouts. Individual shouts don't cost additional Refresh but require story justification to learn.
integration_with_fate_core.aspect_invocations: Can invoke appropriate aspects to reduce Fate Point cost, extend cooldown, or boost effect. Example: Invoke 'True Son of Skyrim' to use Unrelenting Force without Fate Point once per session.

gm_guidance.balance_concerns: Thu'um is powerful but limited by Fate Points and cooldowns. Don't allow spam. Respect the rarity and significance of the Voice.
gm_guidance.story_integration: Learning Thu'um should be a significant character journey, not casual skill acquisition. Create memorable moments around discovery and mastery.
gm_guidance.word_wall_placement: Place Word Walls in dungeons and locations as quest rewards. Make discovery feel earned.
gm_guidance.npc_reactions: Most NPCs are awed or frightened by Thu'um use. Greybeards disapprove of casual combat use. Ulfric's supporters admire it. Imperials may be intimidated.
gm_guidance.power_level: Thu'um can swing difficult battles but shouldn't trivialize challenges. Use cooldowns and Fate Point costs to maintain balance.
gm_guidance.lore_respect: The Voice is sacred to Nords. Using it frivolously or for evil purposes should have social consequences.

example_character_progression.session_0: Nord warrior chooses 'Voice of the Nord' Extra, learns one word of Unrelenting Force (Fus), starts with 2/8 mastery segments
example_character_progression.session_3: Discovers Word Wall in Bleak Falls Barrow, learns second word (Ro), now has 3/8 segments
example_character_progression.session_7: Uses Unrelenting Force in climactic battle against dragon priest, GM awards 2 mastery segments (now 5/8)
example_character_progression.session_10: Spends downtime meditating, roleplay training, fills 1 segment (6/8)
example_character_progression.session_15: Receives training from Greybeard, fills 2 segments (8/8), mastery complete! Can now use Unrelenting Force once per scene without Fate Point
example_character_progression.session 20: Finds third word (Dah) at another Word Wall, starts new mastery clock for 3-word version (0/8 segments)

variant_rules.simplified_mastery: Instead of 8-segment clocks, use 4-segment clocks for faster progression
variant_rules.no_fate_point_cost: Remove Fate Point requirement entirely, rely only on cooldowns. Good for lower-power campaigns.
variant_rules.hardcore_learning: Require completing specific quests to learn each word, not just finding Word Walls. Makes Thu'um much rarer.
variant_rules.voice_of_power: Allow spending 2 Fate Points to use a mastered shout twice in same scene, ignoring cooldown.
